Moving File Status: stcmd move-status

The stcmd move-status command moves file status information from the server in StarTeam 5.1 to the client in StarTeam 5.2 or later releases. This command must be used only before you upgrade the Server from a pre-5.2 release to a post-5.2 release and after you have upgraded the client to 5.2 or later. After you upgrade the server to 5.2 or later, the status information no longer resides on your server.

Before using the command, you must set your personal options to indicate where to store the client-side status information. It can be stored either per folder or in a centralized location. Personal options can be set from the client or the command-line (using stcmd set-personal-options). If no personal options have been set, all commands look for status information in the following centralized locations:

  • For Windows 2000 or XP, C:\Documents and Settings\username\Local Settings\ Application Data\Borland\StarTeam\

  • For Windows NT, the folder in which the application has been installed

  • For non-Windows platforms, /user_home_directory/.starteam-client/

If you move file status information before upgrading the server, all the file statuses become Unknown. Many file statuses can be recalculated afterwards by using the stcmd update-status command at the command line or the File > Update Status command in the clients, but the Merge status, which is of considerable importance, cannot be recalculated. Also, recalculation takes longer than the move-status operation.

As an alternative to moving status information, you can verify that all files are current before upgrading the server to release 5.2 or later.

Syntax

stcmd move-status -p "projectSpecifier" [-pwdfile "filePath"] [-cmp] [-csf] [-encrypt encryptionType] [-is] [-q] [-x] [-stop] [-rp "folderPath" | -fp "folderPath"] [-cfgl "labelName" | -cfgp "stateName" | -cfgd "asOfDate"] [-filter "fileStatus"] [files...]

Example

The following example uses stcmd move-status to transfer all status information for the files in the SourceCode folder and its child folders from the server to the client.

stcmd move-status -p "JMarsh:password@Orion:49201/StarDraw/StarDraw/SourceCode" -is "*"

 

For more information, see Using Common stcmd Options.
